name: Plume

parameters.description: Flow velocity at river mouth

parameters.description: Angle of the coast normal as measured clockwise from north

parameters.description: Normalized width of the along-shore current

parameters.name: Current velocity
parameters.description: Along-shore velocity of the coastal current

parameters.name: Advanced
parameters.description: Advanced

parameters.name: Number of grid nodes in river mouth
parameters.description: Number of computational grid nodes contained within the river mouth

parameters.name: Grid spacing ratio
parameters.description: Ratio of spacing in the along-shore to cross-shore spacing

parameters.description: Resolution of the deposit in the along-shore direction

parameters.name: Cross-shore resolution
parameters.description: Resolution of the deposit in the cross-shore direction

author: Eric Hutton
summary: Plume simulates the sediment transport and deposition of several grainsize classes from a river mouth entering into a marine basin by creating a turbulent jet. The model forms a hypopycnal plume. The model allows for plume deflection due to systematic currents or Coriolis force
